storyTitle: As Task Assignee, I want to receive notifications for task updates to stay informed about my responsibilities

testCases.title: Validate notification sent on task status update
preconditions: User is logged into the system as a task assignee
Task exists in the system with assignee assigned
User has valid email address, phone number, and in-app notification enabled
Notification service is running and operational
User notification preferences are set to default (all channels enabled)

steps.action: Navigate to the task management module and select an existing task assigned to the test user
steps.expectedResult: Task details are displayed with current status visible

steps.action: Update the task status from 'In Progress' to 'Completed' and save the changes
steps.expectedResult: System detects the status update, saves the changes successfully, and triggers the notification generation process

steps.action: Check the user's email inbox for the task update notification
steps.expectedResult: Email notification is received within 1 minute containing correct task name, previous status, new status, update timestamp, and task assignee information

steps.action: Check the user's mobile device for SMS notification
steps.expectedResult: SMS notification is received within 1 minute containing task name and new status information

steps.action: Check the in-app notification center within the application
steps.expectedResult: In-app notification appears in the notification center with complete task details, status change information, and timestamp

steps.action: Navigate to user profile settings and access notification preferences section
steps.expectedResult: Notification preferences page is displayed showing options for email, SMS, and in-app notifications

steps.action: Disable SMS notifications for task updates and save the preferences
steps.expectedResult: Preferences are saved successfully with confirmation message displayed

steps.action: Update the same task status from 'Completed' to 'In Review'
steps.expectedResult: System detects the status update and triggers notification generation

steps.action: Check email, SMS, and in-app notifications for the second update
steps.expectedResult: Email and in-app notifications are received with correct details, but no SMS notification is received, respecting the updated preferences

postconditions: Task status is updated to 'In Review' in the system
All notifications are logged in the notification history
User notification preferences remain as customized (SMS disabled)
Notification delivery records are stored in the database

testCases.title: Verify retry mechanism on notification failure
preconditions: User is logged into the system with admin or test privileges
Task exists in the system with assignee assigned
Notification service is operational
Test environment allows simulation of notification delivery failures
Access to notification logs and monitoring dashboard is available

steps.action: Configure the test environment to simulate email notification delivery failure for the next notification attempt
steps.expectedResult: Email service mock is configured to return failure response on first attempt

steps.action: Update a task status from 'New' to 'In Progress' to trigger notification
steps.expectedResult: System detects status change and attempts to send notification via all configured channels

steps.action: Monitor the notification service logs in real-time during the retry attempts
steps.expectedResult: System logs the initial failure and automatically initiates retry attempt #1 within 30 seconds

steps.action: Continue monitoring as the system performs subsequent retry attempts
steps.expectedResult: System performs retry attempt #2 and retry attempt #3, with each retry logged with timestamp and failure reason

steps.action: Access the notification logs dashboard and filter for the specific task update notification
steps.expectedResult: Notification log entry displays initial attempt timestamp, 3 retry attempt timestamps, failure reasons, and total of 4 delivery attempts

steps.action: Verify the log entry details including task ID, notification type, delivery channel, and retry count
steps.expectedResult: All retry attempts are logged with accurate timestamps (showing intervals between retries), error codes, and delivery status marked as 'Failed after 3 retries'

steps.action: Remove the failure simulation and update the task status again from 'In Progress' to 'Blocked'
steps.expectedResult: System triggers notification and successfully delivers on first attempt

steps.action: Check the notification logs for the successful delivery
steps.expectedResult: Log entry shows successful delivery on first attempt with no retry attempts needed, marked as 'Delivered' with delivery timestamp

postconditions: All notification delivery attempts are logged in the system
Failed notification is marked as permanently failed after 3 retries
Subsequent notifications are delivered successfully
Test environment is restored to normal operation
Notification failure alerts are generated for monitoring team

testCases.title: Ensure immediate notification delivery
preconditions: User is logged into the system with task assignee role
Multiple tasks exist in the system assigned to the test user
Notification service is running with optimal performance
System monitoring and logging tools are active
Timestamp synchronization is enabled across all services

steps.action: Record the current system timestamp as the test start time
steps.expectedResult: Baseline timestamp is captured for performance measurement

steps.action: Update the status of Task #1 from 'New' to 'In Progress' and record the exact update timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Task status is updated successfully and update timestamp is recorded

steps.action: Monitor notification delivery and record the timestamp when notification is received in the in-app notification center
steps.expectedResult: Notification is received within 5 seconds of the task update, delivery timestamp is recorded

steps.action: Calculate the time difference between task update and notification delivery for Task #1
steps.expectedResult: Time difference is less than or equal to 5 seconds, meeting immediate delivery requirement

steps.action: Update the status of Task #2 from 'In Progress' to 'Completed' and record the update timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Task status is updated successfully and timestamp is recorded

steps.action: Monitor and record the notification delivery timestamp for Task #2
steps.expectedResult: Notification is received within 5 seconds and delivery timestamp is recorded

steps.action: Update the status of Task #3 from 'Completed' to 'Archived' and record the update timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Task status is updated successfully and timestamp is recorded

steps.action: Monitor and record the notification delivery timestamp for Task #3
steps.expectedResult: Notification is received within 5 seconds and delivery timestamp is recorded

steps.action: Access the system logs and filter for notification delivery events for all three task updates
steps.expectedResult: System logs display all three notification events with trigger timestamps, processing times, and delivery timestamps

steps.action: Review the logs for any errors, warnings, or delays in the notification processing pipeline
steps.expectedResult: No errors or warnings are recorded; all notifications show successful immediate delivery with processing time under 5 seconds

steps.action: Generate a performance report showing average delivery time across all three notifications
steps.expectedResult: Average delivery time is calculated and confirms all notifications met the immediate delivery requirement (≤5 seconds)

postconditions: All three task status updates are saved in the system
All notifications are delivered successfully within required timeframe
Performance metrics are logged and available for reporting
No errors or delays are recorded in system logs
Notification delivery times are documented for compliance verification

storyTitle: As Task Manager, I want to receive notifications for task delays to proactively manage project timelines

testCases.title: Validate notification sent on task delay detection
preconditions: User is logged into the system with task manager role
Task exists in the system with defined deadline and assigned to a team member
Task deadline monitoring service is active and running
User has valid email address, phone number, and in-app notification enabled
System clock is synchronized and accurate

steps.action: Create or select a task with a deadline set to the current date and time minus 1 hour (simulating a missed deadline)
steps.expectedResult: Task is displayed with status showing 'Overdue' or 'Delayed' and deadline has passed

steps.action: Trigger the system's delay detection process manually or wait for the scheduled delay check cycle to run
steps.expectedResult: System detects that the task deadline has passed without completion and triggers the delay notification generation process

steps.action: Check the task manager's email inbox for the delay notification
steps.expectedResult: Email notification is received within 2 minutes containing task name, original deadline, current delay duration, assigned team member, and task priority

steps.action: Verify the email content includes delay reason if available in the task details
steps.expectedResult: Email displays delay reason field (populated if available, or marked as 'Not specified' if unavailable)

steps.action: Check the task manager's mobile device for SMS notification
steps.expectedResult: SMS notification is received within 2 minutes containing task name, delay status, and deadline information

steps.action: Check the in-app notification center for the delay alert
steps.expectedResult: In-app notification appears with complete delay details including task name, deadline, delay duration, assignee, and actionable links to the task

steps.action: Click on the in-app notification to open the task details page
steps.expectedResult: Task details page opens showing full task information with delay highlighted and acknowledgment option available

steps.action: Click the 'Acknowledge' button on the notification or task details page
steps.expectedResult: Acknowledgment dialog appears prompting for optional comments

steps.action: Enter comment 'Reviewing resource allocation to address delay' and submit the acknowledgment
steps.expectedResult: Acknowledgment is saved successfully with confirmation message displayed, and notification status changes to 'Acknowledged'

steps.action: Navigate to the notification logs or history section
steps.expectedResult: Notification log entry displays the delay notification with acknowledgment timestamp, manager name, and comment text

postconditions: Delay notification is marked as acknowledged in the system
Manager's comment is stored and associated with the task
Notification delivery and acknowledgment are logged with timestamps
Task remains in delayed status until completion or deadline adjustment
Audit trail is created for the notification and acknowledgment

testCases.title: Verify retry mechanism on notification failure
preconditions: User is logged into the system with admin or test privileges
Task exists with passed deadline to trigger delay notification
Notification service is operational
Test environment allows simulation of notification delivery failures
Access to notification logs and system monitoring tools is available

steps.action: Configure the test environment to simulate SMS notification delivery failure for the next notification attempt
steps.expectedResult: SMS service mock is configured to return failure response on initial attempts

steps.action: Set a task deadline to current time minus 30 minutes and ensure task is incomplete to trigger delay detection
steps.expectedResult: Task is marked as delayed in the system

steps.action: Trigger the delay detection process to generate and send delay notification
steps.expectedResult: System detects the delay and attempts to send notification via email, SMS, and in-app channels

steps.action: Monitor the notification service logs in real-time to observe the initial SMS delivery failure
steps.expectedResult: System logs the SMS delivery failure with error code and automatically initiates retry attempt #1 within 30 seconds

steps.action: Continue monitoring the logs as the system performs the second retry attempt
steps.expectedResult: System performs retry attempt #2 after the configured retry interval, logs the attempt with timestamp and failure status

steps.action: Observe the third and final retry attempt in the logs
steps.expectedResult: System performs retry attempt #3, logs the attempt with timestamp, and marks the notification as 'Failed after maximum retries'

steps.action: Access the notification logs dashboard and search for the specific delay notification by task ID
steps.expectedResult: Notification log entry is displayed showing initial attempt timestamp, all 3 retry attempt timestamps with intervals, failure reasons, and final status as 'Delivery Failed'

steps.action: Verify that each retry attempt log entry includes task ID, notification type, delivery channel (SMS), retry count, timestamp, and error details
steps.expectedResult: All log entries contain complete information with accurate timestamps showing progression of retry attempts (initial + 3 retries = 4 total attempts)

steps.action: Check if email and in-app notifications were delivered successfully despite SMS failure
steps.expectedResult: Email and in-app notifications show successful delivery status, confirming that failure in one channel does not affect others

steps.action: Remove the failure simulation and create another delayed task to trigger a new notification
steps.expectedResult: New delay notification is triggered for the second task

steps.action: Verify that the new notification is delivered successfully via all channels including SMS
steps.expectedResult: Notification log shows successful delivery on first attempt for all channels with no retry attempts needed

postconditions: All notification delivery attempts are logged with complete details
Failed notification is marked as permanently failed after 3 retries
System administrator is alerted about the notification delivery failure
Subsequent notifications are delivered successfully after removing failure simulation
Test environment is restored to normal configuration
Failure metrics are recorded for monitoring and reporting

testCases.title: Ensure immediate notification delivery upon delay detection
preconditions: User is logged into the system with task manager role
Multiple tasks exist in the system with different deadlines
Delay detection service is running and configured for immediate processing
System monitoring and performance logging tools are active
All notification channels are operational and responsive

steps.action: Record the current system timestamp as the test baseline
steps.expectedResult: Baseline timestamp is captured for performance measurement

steps.action: Create Task #1 with deadline set to current time minus 15 minutes and status as 'In Progress' (incomplete)
steps.expectedResult: Task #1 is created and saved in the system with overdue status

steps.action: Trigger the delay detection process and record the exact timestamp when delay is detected
steps.expectedResult: System detects Task #1 delay and records detection timestamp

steps.action: Monitor the in-app notification center and record the timestamp when the delay notification appears
steps.expectedResult: Delay notification for Task #1 is received within 5 seconds of delay detection

steps.action: Calculate and document the time difference between delay detection and notification delivery for Task #1
steps.expectedResult: Time difference is less than or equal to 5 seconds, meeting immediate delivery requirement

steps.action: Create Task #2 with deadline set to current time minus 45 minutes and status as 'Not Started'
steps.expectedResult: Task #2 is created and saved with overdue status

steps.action: Trigger delay detection for Task #2 and record detection timestamp
steps.expectedResult: System detects Task #2 delay and records detection timestamp

steps.action: Monitor and record the notification delivery timestamp for Task #2
steps.expectedResult: Delay notification for Task #2 is received within 5 seconds of detection

steps.action: Create Task #3 with deadline set to current time minus 2 hours and status as 'In Progress'
steps.expectedResult: Task #3 is created and saved with significantly overdue status

steps.action: Trigger delay detection for Task #3 and record detection timestamp
steps.expectedResult: System detects Task #3 delay and records detection timestamp

steps.action: Monitor and record the notification delivery timestamp for Task #3
steps.expectedResult: Delay notification for Task #3 is received within 5 seconds of detection

steps.action: Access the system logs and filter for all three delay notification events
steps.expectedResult: System logs display all three delay detection and notification delivery events with complete timestamps and processing details

steps.action: Review the logs for any errors, warnings, delays, or performance issues in the notification pipeline
steps.expectedResult: No errors, warnings, or delays are recorded; all notifications show successful immediate delivery with processing time under 5 seconds

steps.action: Generate a performance summary report calculating average delivery time across all three delay notifications
steps.expectedResult: Performance report shows average delivery time of ≤5 seconds, confirming all notifications met immediate delivery requirement

steps.action: Verify that notification delivery metrics are recorded in the system dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard displays delivery metrics showing 100% success rate and average delivery time within acceptable threshold

postconditions: All three tasks remain in delayed status in the system
All delay notifications are delivered successfully within required timeframe
Performance metrics are logged and available in monitoring dashboard
No errors or delays are recorded in system logs
Notification delivery times are documented for compliance and SLA verification
System continues to monitor tasks for further delays or status changes

storyTitle: As Task Assignee, I want to acknowledge task update notifications to confirm receipt and understanding

testCases.title: Validate task assignee acknowledgment of task update
preconditions: User is logged in as a task assignee
Task update notification has been generated and sent to the assignee
User has appropriate permissions to acknowledge notifications
Notification system is operational

steps.action: Navigate to the notifications section in the application
steps.expectedResult: Notifications page loads successfully and displays the task update notification

steps.action: Locate and click on the task update notification
steps.expectedResult: Notification details are displayed with an acknowledge button visible

steps.action: Click the acknowledge button
steps.expectedResult: Acknowledgment form appears with optional comment field

steps.action: Enter optional comment in the comment field (e.g., 'Understood, will complete by deadline')
steps.expectedResult: Comment text is accepted and displayed in the input field

steps.action: Submit the acknowledgment
steps.expectedResult: System displays confirmation message indicating successful acknowledgment

steps.action: Navigate to system logs or acknowledgment history section
steps.expectedResult: Acknowledgment entry is visible with timestamp, user details, and the entered comment

steps.action: Verify the acknowledgment record contains correct information
steps.expectedResult: Record shows correct assignee name, accurate timestamp, task update reference, and the optional comment entered

postconditions: Acknowledgment is permanently recorded in the system
Notification status is updated to 'Acknowledged'
Audit log contains the acknowledgment entry with all required details
Assignee can view their acknowledgment history

testCases.title: Ensure acknowledgment processing performance
preconditions: User is logged in as a task assignee
Task update notification is available for acknowledgment
System performance monitoring tools are accessible
Network connection is stable

steps.action: Open the task update notification in the application
steps.expectedResult: Notification details are displayed with acknowledge button

steps.action: Note the current time and click the acknowledge button
steps.expectedResult: Acknowledgment form is displayed immediately

steps.action: Submit the acknowledgment via the UI
steps.expectedResult: Acknowledgment is processed and confirmation message appears within 2 seconds

steps.action: Record the time taken from submission to confirmation
steps.expectedResult: Processing time is within acceptable performance threshold (under 3 seconds)

steps.action: Access system logs or admin panel to view acknowledgment entries
steps.expectedResult: System logs are accessible and display recent acknowledgment entries

steps.action: Locate the acknowledgment entry just submitted
steps.expectedResult: Entry is present in the logs with correct timestamp matching submission time

steps.action: Verify all details in the log entry
steps.expectedResult: Log entry contains correct user ID, notification ID, timestamp, and acknowledgment status

postconditions: Acknowledgment is recorded in system logs
Performance metrics confirm prompt processing
No system delays or errors occurred
Notification status reflects acknowledgment

testCases.title: Verify system handles missing acknowledgment gracefully
preconditions: User is logged in as a task assignee
Critical task update notification requiring acknowledgment is available
System validation rules are configured for required fields
User has permissions to acknowledge notifications

steps.action: Open a critical task update notification that requires acknowledgment
steps.expectedResult: Notification details are displayed with required field indicators

steps.action: Click the acknowledge button without completing any required fields
steps.expectedResult: System displays validation error messages indicating which fields are required

steps.action: Attempt to submit the acknowledgment form with missing required fields
steps.expectedResult: System blocks submission and displays clear error messages (e.g., 'Acknowledgment confirmation is required')

steps.action: Verify that the notification status remains unchanged
steps.expectedResult: Notification status is still 'Pending Acknowledgment' and not marked as acknowledged

steps.action: Complete all required fields in the acknowledgment form
steps.expectedResult: Required field indicators are cleared and form appears valid

steps.action: Resubmit the acknowledgment with all required fields completed
steps.expectedResult: System accepts the acknowledgment and displays success confirmation message

steps.action: Verify the acknowledgment is logged in the system
steps.expectedResult: Acknowledgment entry is present in logs with timestamp, user details, and all required information

steps.action: Check the notification status after successful acknowledgment
steps.expectedResult: Notification status is updated to 'Acknowledged' and removed from pending list

postconditions: System validation prevented incomplete acknowledgment submission
Valid acknowledgment was successfully recorded after correction
Audit trail shows both the failed attempt and successful submission
Notification status accurately reflects acknowledgment state

storyTitle: As Task Assignee, I want to customize notification preferences for task updates to control alert frequency and channels

testCases.title: Validate saving and updating task notification preferences
preconditions: User is logged in as a task assignee
User has access to notification preferences settings
Default notification preferences are already configured
At least one task is assigned to the user for testing notifications

steps.action: Navigate to user settings or profile section
steps.expectedResult: Settings page loads successfully with navigation menu visible

steps.action: Click on 'Notification Preferences' or 'Task Notification Settings' option
steps.expectedResult: Task notification preferences UI is displayed showing current preference settings

steps.action: Review the current notification frequency setting
steps.expectedResult: Current frequency preference is displayed (e.g., 'Immediate', 'Daily Digest', 'Weekly Summary')

steps.action: Select a different notification frequency from the dropdown or radio buttons (e.g., change from 'Immediate' to 'Daily Digest')
steps.expectedResult: New frequency option is selected and highlighted in the UI

steps.action: Review available notification channels (e.g., Email, In-App, SMS, Push)
steps.expectedResult: All available notification channels are displayed with checkboxes or toggle switches

steps.action: Select preferred notification channels by checking/unchecking options (e.g., enable Email and In-App, disable SMS)
steps.expectedResult: Selected channels are visually indicated as active, unselected channels are inactive

steps.action: Click the 'Save' or 'Update Preferences' button
steps.expectedResult: System displays success confirmation message (e.g., 'Notification preferences saved successfully')

steps.action: Refresh the preferences page or navigate away and return
steps.expectedResult: Saved preferences are retained and displayed correctly

steps.action: Trigger a task update notification by having another user update an assigned task
steps.expectedResult: Task update event is generated in the system

steps.action: Check the selected notification channels for the notification
steps.expectedResult: Notification is received only through the selected channels (Email and In-App) according to the chosen frequency (Daily Digest)

steps.action: Verify that disabled channels did not receive the notification
steps.expectedResult: No notification is received via SMS or other disabled channels

postconditions: Notification preferences are saved in the user preferences database
Future notifications are delivered according to saved preferences
Preference changes are logged in the audit trail
User can modify preferences again at any time

testCases.title: Verify validation of invalid inputs
preconditions: User is logged in as a task assignee
User has access to notification preferences settings
System validation rules are configured for frequency and channel inputs
Browser developer tools are available for testing edge cases

steps.action: Navigate to task notification preferences UI
steps.expectedResult: Notification preferences page is displayed with all input fields

steps.action: Attempt to enter an invalid frequency value (e.g., manually enter 'InvalidFrequency' via browser console or by manipulating the form)
steps.expectedResult: System detects invalid input and displays validation error message

steps.action: Try to select an unsupported or invalid channel value (e.g., manipulate form data to include 'FakeChannel')
steps.expectedResult: System displays validation error indicating the channel is not valid

steps.action: Attempt to save preferences with invalid frequency or channel values
steps.expectedResult: System rejects the input, displays clear error messages (e.g., 'Please select a valid notification frequency', 'Invalid channel selected'), and prevents saving

steps.action: Verify that the previous valid preferences remain unchanged
steps.expectedResult: Original preferences are still active and no changes were saved

steps.action: Correct the frequency input by selecting a valid option from the dropdown (e.g., 'Immediate')
steps.expectedResult: Valid frequency is selected and error message for frequency is cleared

steps.action: Correct the channel selection by choosing valid channels (e.g., Email, In-App)
steps.expectedResult: Valid channels are selected and error message for channels is cleared

steps.action: Click 'Save' button with corrected valid inputs
steps.expectedResult: System accepts the preferences, displays success confirmation, and saves the settings

steps.action: Verify the saved preferences in the UI
steps.expectedResult: Corrected preferences are displayed accurately in the settings page

postconditions: Invalid inputs were rejected and not saved to the database
Valid preferences were successfully saved after correction
System validation prevented data corruption
Error messages provided clear guidance for correction

testCases.title: Ensure immediate effect of preference changes
preconditions: User is logged in as a task assignee
User has existing notification preferences configured
Test environment allows triggering of notification events
Multiple notification channels are available for testing

steps.action: Navigate to task notification preferences UI
steps.expectedResult: Current notification preferences are displayed

steps.action: Note the current preference settings (e.g., Frequency: 'Daily Digest', Channels: 'Email only')
steps.expectedResult: Current settings are clearly visible and documented

steps.action: Change the notification frequency to 'Immediate'
steps.expectedResult: Frequency is updated to 'Immediate' in the UI

steps.action: Add additional notification channels (e.g., enable 'In-App' and 'Push' notifications)
steps.expectedResult: New channels are selected and visually indicated as active

steps.action: Click 'Save' to update preferences
steps.expectedResult: System displays confirmation message 'Preferences updated successfully' and saves changes immediately

steps.action: Note the timestamp of the preference update
steps.expectedResult: Current time is recorded for comparison with notification delivery

steps.action: Immediately trigger a task update notification event (e.g., have another user update a task assigned to the test user)
steps.expectedResult: Task update event is generated in the system

steps.action: Check for notification delivery across all newly enabled channels within 1-2 minutes
steps.expectedResult: Notification is received immediately via Email, In-App, and Push channels according to the updated 'Immediate' frequency setting

steps.action: Verify the notification was not sent according to the old preferences
steps.expectedResult: Notification delivery reflects the new preferences, not the old 'Daily Digest' setting

steps.action: Check system logs or audit trail for preference change record
steps.expectedResult: Preference change is logged with timestamp, user ID, old values, and new values

postconditions: Notification preferences are updated in real-time
Subsequent notifications are delivered according to new preferences
No delay in applying preference changes
Preference change is logged in audit trail for compliance
